result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M. Altreuther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $200 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with Heather Lupo, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven M. Altreuther
Current: 820 Winchester Court, Nekoosa, WI 54457 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2015)
Prior: 3216 100th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Steven M. Altreuther, appeared with Attorney John Schiro specially for Attorney George David Kidd.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved and court finds the charge is not accurate within the criminal complaint and State moves to amend complaint to "Violation of Temporary Restraining Order - Injunction" 813.125 on the record.  DE pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 45 days in the KCJ w/ Huber.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Court imposes a fine of $200 plus costs to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Heather L. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights given.
Final pre-trial at 09-30-2015 10:30 am
Earliest date available for Atty Kidd is 9/30 at 10:30 AM as he is unavailable any sooner due to trials.
FPT rescheduled to 9/4/15 at 9:30 AM pending confirmation from Atty Schiro
Court has reviewed and approves request for adjournment with no objection by the State.
received from Atty Schiro requesting to rescheduling hearing on 7/24/15.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
